abstracts.cdata!:
For the adverse environmental impacts of
            the Second Anhui Provincial Highway Project, this
            environmental assessment describes the measures to avoid,
            mitigate, or otherwise compensate for adverse impacts that
            might result. Although the report elaborates on mitigation
            measures that will be incorporated into the project design,
            this abstract will focus solely on measures to alleviate
            impacts during the construction and operation phases. During
            construction, to protect biodiversity, restore temporary
            land uses; notify forest authorities first before
            undertaking activities in sensitive woodland areas or near
            natural habitats; avoid noisy construction at night; define
            protective zones or build protection/walls/slopes; carefully
            select borrow pits and waste disposal sites; strictly
            control wood product usage; and provide contractors
            education and training. Other measures to control noise
            include restricting the operation of heavy machinery during
            the daytime, erecting temporary noise barriers, and
            redirecting traffic during the day while banning traffic
            altogether at night. To reduce adverse impacts to surface
            water, use cofferdam techniques in bridge column
            construction and completely isolate work areas; wait until
            low flow period to do river crossing construction
            activities; and treat sewage before discharging. To minimize
            air pollution, spray water to suppress dust; locate mixing
            stations and other emissions sources leeward, far enough
            from sensitive receptors; and cover dump trucks with canvass
            and parking places with bamboo or straw sheet. To preserve
            cultural relics, halt work until archeologists can examine
            "chance finds" and contractors will receive
            training in identifying and protecting cultural relics.
            During the operational phase, to protect the ecosystem,
            build pest management stations, inspect motor vehicles, ban
            vehicle horn blowing in places wildlife frequent, and
            establish emergency procedures to save wounded animals. To
            control noise impacts, prevent sensitive facilities from
            being built with a specified distance from roads and
            highways; and enforce traffic management and use traffic
            signage. Enforce applicable standards for motor vehicles and
            fuels and implement motor vehicle inspection programs to
            reduce air emissions. Prevent vehicles leaking fuel from
            going near sensitive water bodies; and monitor the transport
            of hazardous materials and an emergency response system as
            well as strictly enforce licensing and permit procedures.
